intro: Eleocharis eglerioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in dense clusters at the base of the plant. Eleocharis eglerioides plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
